fulltext:
GIANG BUI  
Hanoi, Vietnam | Tel: 0961891581 | Email: giang.buihg@gmail.com  
SKILLS 
Time management 
Operation management 
Leadership 
Teamwork 
Public speaking 
Customer Service 
Problem-solving 
Communication 
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE 
UNIQLO JAPAN                                                                                    
Tokyo, Japan 
Store Manager Candidate, Sales and Store Operations Department 
2016 - 2018 
• 
Monitored daily floor operation of UNIQLO Super Store with an average $3 million monthly revenue, including 
supervision of floor’s staffing schedule, cash register & customer inquiries to achieve consistent 110% daily sale targets 
• 
Managed inventory and provided timely stock report to senior managers; trained staff to use newly-integrated RFID 
system to maintain store’s out-of-stock ratio under 3% 
• 
Led sales associate team of 10 people, created individual training plans, reviewed individual performances monthly, 
and improved staff working efficiency by 10%; 3 sales associates got promoted after training 
• 
Analyzed buying trends and customers feedback to support Operation & Visual Merchandising team in weekly 
meetings; increased footfall by 20% after 6 months taking charge, made store profitable for the first time since opening 
• 
Initiated and integrated “Wow Stories” method in morning talks to build staff’s self-esteem and critical thinking skill, 
reduced turnover rate by 20% and customer complaints by 15% in 2018 
KOREA EXPRESSWAY CORPORATION 
Hanoi, Vietnam 
Assistant Project Manager 
2013 - 2016 
• 
Coordinated the finalization of Project “Enhancing Capacity on Operation & Management of Expressway Network in 
Vietnam” funded by Korea International Cooperation Agency and approved by Vietnam Ministry of Transport  
• 
Negotiated with contractor on revised terms & conditions of Hanoi – Hai Phong Expressway Design project connecting 
two major cities in North Vietnam, helped complete the transaction that had been delayed for 2 years 
• 
Developed & conducted cross-country dialogues between Korea and Vietnam public authorities to establish effective 
communication, organized Signing Ceremony between Korea Ministry of Land, Infrastructure & Transport and 
Vietnam Ministry of Transport in May 2015 
BRITISH EMBASSY HANOI                                                                                                                     Hanoi, Vietnam  
Temporary Entry Clearance Assistant                                                                                            
 2013 - 2013 
• 
Initiated simplified reference & data check system for visa applicants, increased efficiency by 10%, boosted customer 
satisfaction & success rate by 20% within 5 months 
• 
Led British Embassy’s internal staff engagement initiatives and community building events, collaborated with other 
functions to enhance employee well-being and relations; engaged 100% workforce population  
• 
Hosted Photo Exhibition event on the theme of “Vietnam-UK Relations – from the Past to the Future” which celebrated 
40 years anniversary of the two countries’ diplomatic relations and promoted British culture in Vietnam 
EDUCATION 
HANOI UNIVERSITY 
Hanoi, Vietnam 
Bachelor of Arts (BA), English Language Studies 
2013 
• 
Team leader & Winner - Culture Discovery Contest; English Department’s merit-based scholarship recipient; Summer 
exchange program at The Asia Institute for Political Economy;  
• 
Full Scholarship - Digital Design Course taught by FPT University  
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION 
• 
Languages: Vietnamese (Native), English (Fluent), Japanese (N2)  
• 
Co-founder – Hanoi English Public Speaking Club; ‘Effective Coaching’ Toastmaster Keyforce Club Japan- 
International Toastmaster; International Student Intern – American Embassy

educations.major_categories_detail: Ngôn ngữ, văn học và văn hóa nước ngoài

• Analyzed buying trends and customers feedback to support Operation & Visual Merchandising team in weekly meetings; increased footfall by 20% after 6 months taking charge, made store profitable for the first time since opening
• Initiated and integrated “Wow Stories” method in morning talks to build staff’s self-esteem and critical thinking skill, reduced turnover rate by 20% and customer complaints by 15% in 2018
